SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc.internal

Class RpcUtils

java.lang.Object
sh.brane.rpc.internal.RpcUtils
@InternalApi public final class RpcUtils extends Object
Internal utility methods for RPC data encoding, decoding, and error handling.

This class consolidates common RPC-related operations used across the RPC layer:

  • Hex quantity encoding/decoding (numbers ↔ "0x..." strings)
  • JSON-RPC error data extraction
  • Type conversion helpers
  • Shared ObjectMapper instance

Internal Use Only: This class is not part of the public API. It exists to eliminate code duplication between RPC implementations. Methods are public only due to cross-package access requirements within the SDK.

See Also:
  • RpcException

  • Field Details

    • MAPPER

      public static final com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper MAPPER
      Shared, thread-safe ObjectMapper instance for JSON serialization/deserialization.

      ObjectMapper is expensive to create and thread-safe after configuration, so a single shared instance is used across all RPC classes.

      Jackson Configuration

      This mapper uses Jackson's default configuration with no additional modules registered:

      • No custom modules registered (e.g., no JavaTimeModule, Jdk8Module)
      • Default serialization/deserialization settings
      • Unknown properties are NOT ignored by default (can fail on unknown fields)
      • Standard JSON parsing (no comments, trailing commas, etc.)

      Brane Type Handling

      Brane domain types (Address, Wei, Hash, etc.) are NOT automatically serializable as they lack Jackson annotations. The RPC layer handles these types by:

      • Manually extracting primitive values (e.g., address.value()) before serialization
      • Constructing domain objects from parsed JSON primitives

      Customization

      This mapper is intentionally not configurable to maintain simplicity and consistency across the SDK. If you need custom serialization behavior:

      • Use your own ObjectMapper for application-level JSON processing
      • The Brane RPC layer will continue using this internal mapper for JSON-RPC

      Thread Safety: This instance is safe for concurrent use across threads. Do not modify its configuration after initialization.

      See Also:
      • ObjectMapper

    • HTTP_SCHEMES

      public static final Set<String> HTTP_SCHEMES
      HTTP/HTTPS schemes for RPC endpoint URLs. Insertion order preserved for consistent error messages.

    • WS_SCHEMES

      public static final Set<String> WS_SCHEMES
      WebSocket schemes for RPC endpoint URLs. Insertion order preserved for consistent error messages.

  • Method Details

    • extractErrorData

      public static String extractErrorData(Object dataValue)
      Recursively extracts error data from complex JSON-RPC error responses.

      JSON-RPC errors can have nested data structures. This method:

      • Returns hex strings (starting with "0x") immediately as revert data
      • Recursively searches maps, arrays, and iterables for nested hex data
      • Falls back to string representation if no hex data found

      Common patterns:

      • Node returns {data: "0x..."}, extracts to "0x..."
      • Node returns {data: {data: "0x..."}}, extracts nested "0x..."
      • Non-hex strings fall through as error messages
      Parameters:
      dataValue - the error data object from JSON-RPC response
      Returns:
      extracted error data string (hex preferred), or null if dataValue is null

    • extractFromIterable

      public static String extractFromIterable(Iterable<?> iterable, Object fallback)
      Extracts hex error data from an iterable, preferring "0x..." values.

    • extractFromArray

      public static String extractFromArray(Object array, Object fallback)
      Extracts hex error data from an array, preferring "0x..." values.

    • toRpcException

      public static RpcException toRpcException(JsonRpcError err)
      Creates an RpcException from a JSON-RPC error response.

      This factory method consolidates the common pattern of converting a JsonRpcError to an RpcException, including proper extraction of error data.

      Parameters:
      err - the JSON-RPC error from the response
      Returns:
      a new RpcException with the error details

    • stringValue

      public static String stringValue(Object value)
      Safely converts object to string, returning null for null inputs.

    • decodeHexLong

      public static long decodeHexLong(Object value)
      Decodes a hex quantity string to long.

      This method handles the "0x" prefix and treats null/empty values as zero, which aligns with JSON-RPC conventions where absent or empty fields often represent zero values.

      Null/Empty Handling:

      • null → 0L
      • "" (empty string) → 0L
      • "0x" (prefix only) → 0L
      • "0x0" → 0L
      • "0x1a" → 26L

      Note: This lenient behavior is intentional for RPC parsing. If you need strict validation that rejects null/empty strings, validate the input before calling this method.

      Parameters:
      value - the hex string to decode, may be null or empty
      Returns:
      the decoded value (returns 0L for null/empty input)
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string contains invalid hex characters
      See Also:
      • decodeHexBigInteger(String)

    • decodeHexBigInteger

      public static BigInteger decodeHexBigInteger(String hex)
      Decodes a hex quantity string to BigInteger.

      This method handles the "0x" prefix and treats null/empty values as zero, which aligns with JSON-RPC conventions where absent or empty fields often represent zero values.

      Null/Empty Handling:

      • null → BigInteger.ZERO
      • "" (empty string) → BigInteger.ZERO
      • "0x" (prefix only) → BigInteger.ZERO
      • "0x0" → BigInteger.ZERO
      • "0x1a" → BigInteger.valueOf(26)

      Note: This lenient behavior is intentional for RPC parsing. If you need strict validation that rejects empty strings, validate the input before calling this method.

      Parameters:
      hex - the hex string to decode, may be null or empty
      Returns:
      the decoded value, never null (returns BigInteger.ZERO for null/empty input)
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string contains invalid hex characters

    • toQuantityHex

      public static String toQuantityHex(BigInteger value)
      Converts BigInteger to hex quantity string with "0x" prefix.

    • toHexBlock

      public static String toHexBlock(Long block)
      Converts Long block number to hex string with "0x" prefix, handling null.

    • toJsonAccessList

      public static List<Map<String,Object>> toJsonAccessList(List<AccessListEntry> entries)
      Converts an access list to JSON-RPC format for transaction calls.

      Each entry is converted to a map with:

      • address: The contract address as hex string
      • storageKeys: List of storage slot hashes as hex strings
      Parameters:
      entries - the access list entries
      Returns:
      list of maps suitable for JSON-RPC serialization

    • buildTxObject

      public static Map<String,Object> buildTxObject(TransactionRequest request, Address from)
      Builds a transaction object map suitable for JSON-RPC calls like eth_estimateGas and eth_call.

      Converts a TransactionRequest into the map format expected by Ethereum JSON-RPC methods. Only non-null fields are included in the output.

      Output fields:

      • from: Sender address (required)
      • to: Recipient address (optional)
      • value: Wei value as hex quantity (optional)
      • data: Call data as hex string (optional)
      • accessList: EIP-2930 access list (optional)
      Parameters:
      request - the transaction request
      from - the sender address to use (overrides request.from() if different)
      Returns:
      map suitable for JSON-RPC serialization

    • timedEstimateGas

      public static String timedEstimateGas(Map<String,Object> tx, Supplier<String> rpcCall)
      Executes an eth_estimateGas call with consistent debug logging and timing.

      This method extracts the common pattern used by DefaultSigner and SmartGasStrategy for gas estimation:

      1. Logs the estimate gas request (from, to, data)
      2. Times the RPC call execution
      3. Logs the result with timing information

      The actual RPC call is delegated to the provided supplier, allowing callers to use their own error handling and RPC mechanisms.

      Parameters:
      tx - the transaction object map (must contain "from", optionally "to" and "data")
      rpcCall - supplier that executes the actual eth_estimateGas RPC call
      Returns:
      the gas estimate as a hex string (e.g., "0x5208")
      Throws:
      RpcException - if the RPC call fails (propagated from supplier)

    • validateUrl

      public static void validateUrl(String url, Set<String> allowedSchemes)
      Validates a URL string for RPC endpoint configuration.

      This method performs common URL validation used by RPC configuration classes:

      • Checks for null (throws NullPointerException)
      • Validates the URL is a valid URI
      • Validates the scheme is one of the allowed schemes
      • Validates the host is present and non-empty
      Parameters:
      url - the URL string to validate
      allowedSchemes - the set of allowed URL schemes (e.g., "http", "https", "ws", "wss")
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if url is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the URL is invalid or uses an unsupported scheme
